definition: appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe

sentences.english: You will be responsible for any problem, because you do not listen to our well-intentioned words.
sentences.chinese: 我們好言相勸你偏不聽，出什麼差錯你自己負責。

sentences.english: You understand it will be late to counsel them or pray.
sentences.chinese: 那時所有的相勸與祈禱都晚矣。

sentences.english: It will be late to counsel then pray.
sentences.chinese: 到那時再相勸或祈禱依然遲矣。

sentences.english: The mother coaxes the daughter out of go to the party alone.
sentences.chinese: 母親好言相勸，不讓女兒獨自去參加聚會。

sentences.english: Many friends and family are struggling to persuade, but Liu declined.
sentences.chinese: 很多親朋好友都苦苦相勸，但小劉謝絕了。

sentences.english: The mother coaxed the daughter out of going to the party alone.
sentences.chinese: 母親好言相勸，不讓女兒獨自去參加聚會。
